title: Expert appreciate Health Min's remark that there is no proof about efficacy of plasma therapy | Deccan Herald
content: Neeraj Nischal, associate professor in the Department of Medicine at AIIMS, said that in the absence of any specific antiviral medications for the treatment of COVID-19, convalescent plasma ( plasma from patients who have recovered from the illness) is being seen as a promising therapeutic option. But for plasma therapy to be effective, plasma must contain sufficient amount of neutralizing antibody against that infection.
